alert.note: Alert for Ozark; Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 12:23PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Runoff from thunderstorms this morning is diminishing though still high enough to potentially cause localized flooding. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Ozark, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorms that produced localized heavy rain this morning have moved off to the east and south, with more patchy light to moderate rain continuing into this afternoon. - This includes the following low water crossings... Pond Fork at County Road 883, Trigger Creek at Highway J and Wolf Creek at Highway 125. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Hollister, Table Rock, Theodosia, Kirbyville, Pontiac, Sundown, Rueter, Protem, Powersite, Ozark Beach, Isabella, Lake Taneycomo, Bull Shoals Lake, Table Rock Lake and Table Rock State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
